main event: Four unidentified objects were sighted by a civilian observer and an amateur astronomer in Fitchburg, Massachusetts on January 16, 1961.
interesting points: The main object appeared as large as a dime held at arm's length, with three smaller objects accompanying it.
The objects maneuvered in approximately a four-foot square from where the observation took place.
The larger object would hover with the three smaller objects darting in and out of it, before the larger object shot off at a high rate of speed.
The objects were under constant observation for over 2 hours, and were also detected by radar.
The report notes the objects' unusual flight patterns, including looping, zigzagging, and hovering.
witnesses: a civilian observer and an amateur astronomer
